name: Macroeconomics and the Labour Market
description: This course aims to provide students with an overview of recent macroeconomic research on the labour market. Discussion includes theoretical models as well as empirical evidence. Topics include: search frictions, labour market flows, sorting, inequality, occupational mobility, human capital accumulation, and intergenerational mobility. [24L]
exclusions: Students who completed ECO352H5 Special Topics: Macroeconomics & the Labour Market are not eligible.
